boat.name: Golden Vanity
boat.full_description:
'Golden Vanity' is the sole remaining Mumble Bee Trawler (smallest of the Brixham Trawlers) with a 38’9’’ length hull,. She was built by J Sanders in Galmpton, Devon,1903 and launched in 1908.

Initially used as a working vessel, she provided a painting platform for Arthur Briscoe’s observance of the Brixham trawler fleet, and used for leisure sailing. By the 1980s she had become derelict in Brixham harbour before a group of enthusiasts, who subsequently became the Golden Vanity Trust, accomplished a full renovation and sailed her under their flag.

In 1999 Trinity Sailing obtained her in order to carry out RYA courses and ‘youth adventure sailing’. When Trinity Sailing was forced to downsize First Class Sailing offered her a new home where she will continue to be available for sail training.
boat.short_description: 'Golden Vanity' was built in 1903 for the marine artist Arthur Briscoe and launched in 1908. Following her restoration, she provides sailing opportunities and courses with First Class Sailing.
